body_text:
@raymak is helping marketing with their "lifecycle management" study.  We're interested in targeting new users as defined by their profile creation date in Telemetry ("creationDate").  This is in a  date string format: "2017-05-23T21:14:23.539Z".
We need some method of targeting users that are within N days of creationDate in their life cycle.  We are agnostic to the solution.  The following would probably be rational, and reusable for other targets: but I think casting a string date to a timestamp int:

Add a function for getting the current datetime in string or int (time since epoch)
Add a function to cast a string datetime to an int (time since epoch)

e.g. ( (today() - toTimestamp(creationDate) ) / (24 * 60 * 60) ) > 14
Obviously we need to be conscious of all of the fun baggage that comes with dates :)
